facts: Albertosaurus was named by Henry Fairfield Osborn in a one-page note at the end of his 1905 description of Tyrannosaurus rex.
Albertosaurus was a member of the Caliasaurus family, which includes some of the most interestings dinosaurs ever discovered.
Albertosaurus was a bipedal predator that walked on two powerful legs.
First discovered in 1889 by Othniel Charles Marsh
Triceratops means three-horned face
The Triceratops had up to 800 teeth
The largest known skull measures in at 5 feet long.
Tyrannosaurus Rex lived in the late Cretaceous Period.
Tyrannosaurus Rex was one of the last non-avian dinosaurs to exist before the Cretaceous-Paleogene extinction event.
Anklyosaurus survived for approximately 135 million years.
Anklyosaurus was one of the last dinosaurs to go extinct.
Anklyosaurus was a quadrupedal dinosaur.
An asteroid was named 9954 Brachiosaurus in 1991.
Brachiosaurus was first discovered in 1903 by Elmer S. Riggs.
Brachiosaurus lived in the late Jurassic period.
The Stegosaurus had between 17 and 22 seperate places and flat spines.
The Stegosaurus had a brain the size of a walnut.
The spikes on a Stegosaurus' tail are called the thagomizer.
Elasmosaurus was a marine reptile first discovered in Kansas.
Elasmosaurus was the largest marine reptile.
Elasmosaurus had a neck that was 80 feet long.
Actually a flying reptile, the Pteranodon is not a dinosaur.
Pteranodon lived in North America.
The Pteranodon had a wingspan of up to 33 feet.
All birds are living dinosaurs.
